defs: the stalk of a lotus plant.
Viṣṇu, whose eyes are wide and beautiful like lotus flower (or its petal).
a woman having beautiful lotus-like eyes.
a petal of a lotus flower.
a woman having beautiful eyes like lotus-petals.
the sun, as a friend of lotus flowers.
(myth.) Manmata, who uses lotus flower as an arrow.
Brahma, who manifested himself on a lotus.
a woman having beautiful face resembling a fully blown lotus flower.
the sun.
an elephant.
the belly.
Brahma.
a peacock.
a hermit; a religious ascetic.
a short, stabbing weapon whose blade has two curves.
the sugary substance in the lotus flowers.
a small drum that is played by holding in one hand and striking with the other.
any small bird of the genus Motacilla with a long tail in frequent up and down motion; a wagtail.

the sun, as a friend of lotus flowers.

a multitude of lotus flowers.

the lotus plant, which is born in water.
the upper part of the human body, containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; the head.

a woman having beautiful face resembling a fully blown lotus flower.
a multitude of lotus flowers.

a mean or stingy person who hoards wealth and lives miserably; a miser.
the characteristic of a miser; greediness; stinginess; miserliness.
a woman having beautiful lotus-like eyes.
(fig.) lustre of the eye.

that portion of a vessel above its neck.

a male cat; a tom-cat.
a stiff sharp-pointed projection on a plant; a thorn.
(fig.) a constant annoyance or the person causing it.
(fig.) a person or thing that obstructs progress; an obstacle.
erection of hair of the head or body, as from fear; goose flesh; horripilation.
a man who hunts animals for his living; a hunter; a fowler.
(astrol.) any of the first, fourth, seventh or tenth houses in the astrological diagram of a person.
the plant Solanum surattense (=S. xanthocarpum) of Solanaceae family; wild brinjal.
armed hostilities between two nations; conflict; a war.
to have, possess thorns on the body (as a plant).
(fig.) to be involved in a trouble or troubles.
a wheel having a series of projections, like teeth, on the edge for transferring or receiving motion through a chain, belt or another similar wheel; a cogged wheel.

any marine invertebrate of the phylum Echinodermata, which includes starfishes, sea urchins, brittle-stars, crinoids, and sea cucumbers, typically having five-fold symmetry, a calcareous skeleton, and tube feet operated by water pressure; echinoderm.
determination - a) the quality of being resolute; b) a firm intention.
a thick door (as of a fort or as the main entrance of a town, temple etc.) strengthened with horn-like metal projections.
(fig.) the state of being free or freed from obstacles, difficulties or dangers.
(fig.) he who has overcome obstacles, difficulties or dangers on his way.
the fruit of the tree Artocarpus integra of Moraceae family, with thick skin having thorn-like hard projections; jackfruit.
(fig.) a hostile king.
(fig.) he who causes, is causing annoyance, danger; a man who is unfriendly, antagonistic.
the condition or fact of (a thorn) being crooked (as of the thorn on rose plant).
the quality or tendency of a person who annoys another or others constantly.
the state or fact of being full of thorns; a thorny condition.
the condition of being full of obstacles, vexations, pain, etc.

the plant Solanum surattense (=S. xanthocarpum) of Solanaceae family.
its fruit; wild brinjal.
foot coverings, as shoes, boots, slippers, etc.; footwear.

ಕಂದಾಚಾರ ಕಚೇರಿ kandācāra kacēri one of the eighteen government departments, that looked after the military or police service, in erstwhile system; ಕಂದಾಚಾರ ಕಛೇರಿ kandācāra kachēri = ಕಂದಾಚಾರ ಕಚೇರಿ; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ದಫೇದಾರ kandācārada daphēdāra a police or military superintendent over a contingent of armed forces; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ಭಂಟ kandācārada bhaṇṭa = ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ವಾಲೆಕಾರ; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ಭಕ್ಷಿ kandācārada bhakṣi the chief officer of the military or police department of a government in erstwhile system; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದವ kandācāradava a man in the service of police or military department of a government; 2. a man of superstititions, blind faith; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ವಾಲೆಕಾರ kandācārada vālekāra an armed soldier or policeman; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ಸೇರ್ವೆಗಾರ kandācārada sērvegāra = ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ದಫೇದಾರ; ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ಹೋಬಳಿದಾರ kandācārada hōbaḷidāra = ಕಂದಾಚಾರದ ದಫೇದಾರ.
